sentences.english: He was also a reckless adventurer who got lucky.
sentences.chinese: 同時他也是一位輕率魯莽而運氣十足的冒險家。

sentences.english: Natives will cringe and squirm with embarrassment at such brashness.
sentences.chinese: 對於這種輕率魯莽，當地人會因尷尬而戰戰兢兢。

sentences.english: He withdrew precipitately from the race.
sentences.chinese: 他輕率地從比賽中退出。

sentences.english: For a black man to be so brash was unique at the time.
sentences.chinese: 一個黑人如此輕率無禮在當時是很少見的。

sentences.english: I trust an indiscreet fool and suspect a lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 吾信任輕率之傻子而猜疑律師。

sentences.english: He never speaks unadvisedly about anything.
sentences.chinese: 他從不輕率地談論任何事情。

sentences.english: You must be frank; but without indiscretion; and close, without being costive.
sentences.chinese: 你必須坦誠而不輕率，掌握分寸而不吝嗇小氣。

sentences.english: Both men blame German imprudence for their losses.
sentences.chinese: 兩人都對他們的損失歸咎於德國輕率。

sentences.english: They accused her of flippancy and subjectivity in her reporting of events in their country.
sentences.chinese: 他們指責她在報道他們國家的事件時輕率而主觀。

sentences.english: Hasty love is soon hot and shortly cold.
sentences.chinese: 草輕率率談戀愛，熱得快也冷得快。

sentences.english: Whatever made John embark on such a hairbrained scheme?
sentences.chinese: 是什麼使得約翰着手這樣一個輕率的計劃？

sentences.english: The imperial censor's indiscreet conducts was countenanced by the hawk immediately.
sentences.chinese: 帝國檢查員輕率行爲立即得到了鷹派成員的肯定。

sentences.english: The thief did not get off lightly and was sentenced to ten years in jail.
sentences.chinese: 小偷並沒有被輕率地放走，而是被處罰坐牢十年。

sentences.english: Thoughtless boy have deface the desk by marking on them.
sentences.chinese: 輕率的男孩子們在桌面上亂畫而把桌面弄壞了。

definition: to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to turn a blind eye to
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
